clinical_study.brief_title: Norepinephrine Prophylaxis for Postspinal Anesthesia Hypotension
clinical_study.official_title: Norepinephrine Prophylaxis for Postspinal Anesthesia Hypotension in Parturients Undergoing Cesarean Section: a Randomized, Placebo-controlled Dose-finding Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: General Hospital of Ningxia Medical University

clinical_study.source: General Hospital of Ningxia Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the suitable infusion dose of norepinephrine for prophylaxis against post-spinal anesthesia hypotension.

detailed_description.textblock: Post-spinal anesthesia hypotension is a frequent complication during spinal anesthesia for cesarean section. The incidence of post-spinal anesthesia hypotension is as high as 62.1-89.7% if prophylactic measures are not taken. Vasopressors has been highly recommended for routine prevention and/or treatment of post-spinal anesthesia hypotension. As a potential substitute drug for phenylephrine, norepinephrine has gradually been used in parturients undergoing cesarean section. There's some evidence that prophylactic infusion of norepinephrine could effectively reduce the incidence of post-spinal anesthesia hypotension in parturients undergoing cesarean section. But the ideal infusion dose of norepinephrine is still unknown. The purpose of this study is to investigate the suitable infusion dose of norepinephrine for prophylaxis against post-spinal anesthesia hypotension.

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence of post-spinal anesthesia hypotension
primary_outcome.description: Systolic blood pressure (SBP) < 80% of the baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall stability of systolic blood pressure control versus baseline
Overall stability of heart rate control versus baseline
The incidence of severe post-spinal anesthesia hypotension.
secondary_outcome.description: Systolic blood pressure (SBP) < 60% of the baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of nausea and vomiting.
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of nausea and vomiting in patients after spinal anesthesia
Systolic blood pressure (SBP) >120% of the baseline.
A= Appearance P=Pulse G=Grimace A=Attitude R=Respiration
A= Appearance P=Pulse G=Grimace A=Attitude R=Respiration

arm_group.description: Simultaneous with subarachnoid block, a bolus of 1ml normal saline was given followed by normal saline infusion
Simultaneous with subarachnoid block, a bolus of 6μg norepinephrine was given followed by a maintenance dose of norepinephrine (0.025 μg/kg/min).
Simultaneous with subarachnoid block, a bolus of 6μg norepinephrine was given followed by a maintenance dose of norepinephrine (0.05 μg/kg/min).
Simultaneous with subarachnoid block, a bolus of 6μg norepinephrine was given followed by a maintenance dose of norepinephrine (0.075 μg/kg/min).
Simultaneous with subarachnoid block, a bolus of 6μg norepinephrine was given followed by a maintenance dose of norepinephrine (0.1 μg/kg/min).

intervention.description: Simultaneous with subarachnoid block, a bolus of 6μg norepinephrine was given followed by different infusion dose of norepinephrine.
Simultaneous with subarachnoid block, a bolus of 1ml normal saline was given followed by normal saline infusion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-40 years
- Primipara or multipara
- Singleton pregnancy ≥37 weeks
- American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status classification I to II
- Scheduled for elective cesarean section under spinal anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Body height < 150 cm
- Body weight > 100 kg or body mass index (BMI) ≥ 40 kg/m2
- Eclampsia or chronic hypertension or baseline blood pressure ≥ 160mmHg
- Hemoglobin < 7g/dl
- Fetal distress, or known fetal developmental anomaly

overall_official.affiliation: General Hospital of Ningxia Medical University

facility.name: General Hospital of Ningxia Medical University
